title: A2D Framework Overview
text:
Welcome
A2D Framework
AI-Augmented Development for Modern Teams

Welcome to the A2D Framework presentation. This is an example of how to structure presentations using Quarto and Reveal.js.

title: A2D Framework Overview
text:
üß† What Is A2D?
AI-Augmented Development
A methodology that extends Agile for human-AI collaboration across the SDLC

Not replacement: AI augments, doesn‚Äôt replace developers
Structured collaboration: Defined roles and workflows
Quality-focused: Built-in guardrails and review processes
Framework + Service: Both methodology and execution


A2D stands for AI-Augmented Development. It‚Äôs important to emphasize this is about augmentation, not replacement.

title: A2D Framework Overview
text:
Core Concepts


Archetypes
The Playbooks

Reusable blueprints
Technology-specific
Best practices codified
Examples: .NET Core API, React SPA


Agents
The Workforce

AI actors executing work
Follow archetypes
Specialized roles
Examples: Planner, Architect, Coder

title: A2D Framework Overview
text:
Agent Roles








Agent
Responsibility
Code?




Planning Agent
Creates implementation plans, breaks down work
‚ùå No


Solution Architect
Proposes designs, analyzes trade-offs
‚ùå No


CodeLantern Coder
Implements code based on approved plans
‚úÖ Yes






Key Principle: Planning and architecture agents explicitly do NOT write code

title: A2D Framework Overview
text:
Planning Workflow





flowchart TD
    A[User Request] --> B{Entry Point}
    B -->|Chat| C[Planning Agent Creates Plan]
    B -->|Existing Issue| D[Planning Agent Updates Plan]
    C --> E[Creates GitHub Issue]
    D --> E
    E --> F[Structured Plan with AC]
    F --> G[Ready for Implementation]
    
    classDef human fill:#e1f5ff,stroke:#0066cc
    classDef ai fill:#fff4e1,stroke:#ff6b35
    class A,G human
    class C,D,F ai

title: A2D Framework Overview
text:
Two Entry Points

From Chat: User describes need, agent creates new issue with plan
From Existing Issue: User provides issue link, agent adds structured plan

Result: Consistent planning format with acceptance criteria, scope, and risks

title: A2D Framework Overview
text:
MCP Architecture
Model Context Protocol enables agent-to-tool communication
# Example: Agent tool configuration
tools:
  - "read"
  - "search"
  - "edit"
  - "github-mcp-server/issue_write"
Hierarchy: Server ‚Üí Toolset ‚Üí Tool ‚Üí Method

title: A2D Framework Overview
text:
Benefits

‚ö° Speed: Faster development cycles
üìã Structure: Consistent planning and documentation
üéØ Quality: Built-in guardrails and review processes
üìö Knowledge: Archetypes capture institutional knowledge
üîÑ Flexibility: Adapts to existing workflows

title: A2D Framework Overview
text:
Getting Started

Understand the framework ‚Äì Review documentation
Define archetypes ‚Äì Create technology-specific blueprints
Configure agents ‚Äì Set up tools and permissions
Start small ‚Äì Pilot with one team/project
Iterate ‚Äì Refine based on feedback

title: A2D Framework Overview
text:
Questions?
Contact: CodeLantern.AI
Documentation: See /a2d/ and /agents/ directories
Next Steps: Review detailed agent definitions and workflow docs

Open floor for questions. Key documents to reference: a2d-framework-overview.md, planning-workflow.md, agent definitions.

title: A2D Framework Overview
text:
Thank You
A2D Framework
Augmenting Development, Not Replacing Developers

title: CodeLantern
text:
Welcome
CodeLantern
CodeLantern is a new company focused on ai-assisted or agent-assisted development.

Not replacement: AI augments, doesn‚Äôt replace developers
Structured collaboration: Defined roles and workflows
Quality-focused: Built-in guardrails and review processes
Framework + Service: Both methodology and execution


Welcome to the A2D Framework presentation. This is an example of how to structure presentations using Quarto and Reveal.js.

title: CodeLantern
text:
CodeLantern
Transforming software development through AI-augmented collaboration.

Professional services delivering A2D enablement
Proprietary tools & methodology as our competitive advantage
Empower development teams to achieve 10x velocity with human control
Solve business problems for organizations lacking dev resources


Opening remarks: - CodeLantern is pioneering the A2D (AI-Augmented Development) space - We‚Äôre not replacing developers - we‚Äôre amplifying their capabilities through structured human-AI collaboration - Our business model has two revenue streams: enablement services (teaching teams our methodology) and delivery services (using our methodology to build solutions) - Key differentiator: we‚Äôve developed proprietary archetypes (best-practice blueprints) and agents that execute these playbooks - The ‚Äúhuman control‚Äù aspect is critical - we maintain guardrails that prevent agents from making unchecked decisions - Target market includes both tech companies wanting to accelerate development and non-tech companies needing development capabilities

title: CodeLantern
text:
Brand Identity











Illuminating the path through AI-augmented development




Guiding light for teams navigating the complexity of AI collaboration




Trusted beacon in the evolving landscape of software development




Expert partnership combining methodology, tools, and proven results




Brand positioning: - The ‚Äúlantern‚Äù metaphor represents guidance, clarity, and illumination in a complex space - We‚Äôre not selling hype - we‚Äôre providing practical, proven methodology - Brand values: pragmatism, transparency, human-centricity, excellence - Visual identity emphasizes professionalism and technical credibility - We position ourselves as thought leaders and practitioners, not just consultants

title: CodeLantern
text:
Company Foundation


Legal Entity

CodeLantern Inc.

Digital Presence

Primary: codelantern.ai
Redirect: codelantern.com
Instagram: @codelantern
LinkedIn: CodeLantern
YouTube: @CodeLantern


Core Methodology

A2D Framework

AI Augmented Development?
AI Assisted Development?


Open Approach

Community-driven methodology
Similar to Agile evolution
Proprietary tools + open process



Company structure decisions: - Legal entity will be CodeLantern Inc.¬†for professional credibility - Using .ai domain for primary presence signals our AI focus and modern positioning - .com will redirect to maintain brand consistency and catch alternative traffic
A2D terminology decision: - ‚ÄúAugmented‚Äù implies enhancement and amplification of developer capabilities - ‚ÄúAssisted‚Äù implies help and support, potentially weaker positioning - Current recommendation: ‚ÄúAugmented‚Äù for stronger value proposition
Open vs.¬†proprietary strategy: - Consider opensourcing the A2D methodology framework similar to how Agile evolved - Keeps methodology and best practices as community contribution - Proprietary advantage comes from our tools, archetypes, and implementation expertise - This positions us as thought leaders while protecting commercial value - Creates ecosystem effect and drives adoption

title: A2D ‚Äì AI-Augmented Development
text:
A2D
AI Augmented Development
AI Assisted Development

title: A2D ‚Äì AI-Augmented Development
text:
A2D is not vibe coding
Vibe Coding ‚Äî Definition

Development approach where the human sets the direction and the AI handles the details

Emphasis on speed, experimentation, and ‚Äúvibes‚Äù rather than clear structure

Heavy reliance on natural-language prompts with minimal scaffolding

Great for prototypes and quick experiments, but weaker on governance and repeatability

title: A2D ‚Äì AI-Augmented Development
text:
A2D on the spectrum


Traditional Development ‚Äì Little or no AI assistance

Vibe Coding ‚Äì AI drives most implementation; humans steer loosely

A2D ‚Äì Structured collaboration between humans and AI agents, with:

Clear roles
Guardrails and governance
Repeatable workflows

title: A2D ‚Äì AI-Augmented Development
text:
Demo Time


Show GitHub Copilot coding agents in action

Walk through how A2D workflows are executed end-to-end

Anchor the conversation in something tangible and working

title: A2D ‚Äì AI-Augmented Development
text:
A2D Workflows ‚Äì Overview


GitHub & GitHub Copilot ‚Äì Core platform

Model providers ‚Äì OpenAI / Anthropic / Gemini

A2D Artifacts ‚Äì Agent definitions, archetypes, workflows

A2D Subscription ‚Äì Controlled access to IP & tooling

A2D Methodology ‚Äì Ceremonies and ways of working

title: A2D ‚Äì AI-Augmented Development
text:
Foundation: GitHub & A2D

GitHub + GitHub Copilot + GitHub Coding Agents form the execution layer

We rely on:

Repos, PRs, issues, projects, labels, releases

Copilot‚Äôs agent orchestration and tool permissions


Today, GitHub Coding Agents primarily use Claude Sonnet 4.5 underneath

Issue Templates

Written by humans for agents

Standardize:

Requirements
Sizing
Labels & priority

Make work machine-readable and consistent

title: A2D ‚Äì AI-Augmented Development
text:
Agent Definitions

Describe the type of work an agent should complete

Configure:

Access to MCP servers
Tools and permissions
Allowed workflows


Examples:

[planner], [interviewer], [architect]
[curator], [workhorse], [tester]

title: A2D ‚Äì AI-Augmented Development
text:
MCP Registries

GitHub MCP Registry and OpenAI Connector Registry

Provide verified MCP servers for:

GitHub
Figma and design tools
Azure / cloud
Other SaaS and APIs


CodeLantern‚Äôs role:

Curate
Validate
Certify MCPs as production-ready

title: A2D ‚Äì AI-Augmented Development
text:
Archetypes

Blueprints for how agents should build software

Language & framework specific:

.NET, TypeScript, React, CSS
MudBlazor, Databricks, YAML
Terraform, Azure CLI, app archetypes


Curated by expert consultants assisted by [curator] agents

Enforce:

Coding standards
Design patterns
Architectural principles

title: A2D ‚Äì AI-Augmented Development
text:
Workflows

Defined, configured, and approved by the team

Executed by agents, monitored by humans

Examples:

[ux-design], [code-design], [issue-design]
[implement], [deploy]


Each workflow binds:

A goal
The agents
The humans
The artifacts created

title: A2D ‚Äì AI-Augmented Development
text:
Boards & Analytics

A2D workflows surface as board items and analytics in GitHub

Track:

Throughput
Lead time
Agent performance


Provide the telemetry needed to continuously refine the system

title: A2D ‚Äì AI-Augmented Development
text:
Component Definitions







Component
Description




Work Item Templates
Issues, sub-issues, and PRs are structured consistently so agents can read/write them reliably.


Agent Definitions
Describe agent roles and purpose, define allowed tools & workflows, and reinforce use of archetypes and patterns.


Archetypes
Detailed guidance on frameworks and patterns agents must follow. Curated by experts with AI assistance.


Workflows
Define what needs to be done, which agents & humans are involved, and the expected outputs.

title: A2D ‚Äì AI-Augmented Development
text:
Hiding the IP


Agents depend on definitions, archetypes, and workflows stored as Markdown

Markdown is:

Easy to read
Easy to copy
Hard to protect as proprietary IP


We need to:

Conceal and version these artifacts
Keep client copies in sync with a central source
Offer controlled access to paying customers

title: A2D ‚Äì AI-Augmented Development
text:
Conceptual Proposed Solution*

Safeguard IP behind a dedicated CodeLantern MCP server

Publish that MCP server through the GitHub registry

Issue access tokens to subscribers

Support multiple versions:

Backwards compatibility
Ability to evolve with MCP ecosystem changes



* This is a conceptual design; implementation details still to be validated.

title: A2D ‚Äì AI-Augmented Development
text:
Proposed Architecture


Work item (GitHub issue) is assigned to an agent

Agent opens a PR and starts a working session

Client org keeps agent definitions under /.github/agents

MCP servers involved:

GitHub MCP Registry
OpenAI Connector Registry
Figma / UX MCP
Azure MCP
CodeLantern MCP (hides archetype & workflow IP)


Agents execute workflows and submit work for human review

title: A2D ‚Äì AI-Augmented Development
text:
Workflows ‚Äì Visual


Think of each workflow as a binder:

Clear entry criteria
Defined steps
Expected outputs

A2D is a set of binders that teams can adopt and compose

title: A2D ‚Äì AI-Augmented Development
text:
Planning Workflow


Uses the [planning-agent]

Responsibilities:

Enhance descriptions & acceptance criteria
Split large items into sub-items and tasks
Ask clarifying questions where needed


Can recommend next workflows by analyzing:

Repo structure
Existing issues
Nature of the work


Outcome: a high-quality, agent-ready backlog

title: A2D ‚Äì AI-Augmented Development
text:
Suggestion Workflow


Scans:

Current issues
TODOs
Markdown checklists
Test coverage gaps


Produces:

A simple work item summarizing what to work on next


Used by:

Product owners
Architects


Often powered by the same [planning-agent] under the hood

title: A2D ‚Äì AI-Augmented Development
text:
User Interface Design Workflow (Future)


Describe the UI that needs to be built

Generate UI options using project archetypes:

Material Design
MudBlazor
Tailwind, etc.


Present options and refine with stakeholders

Attach the chosen design to a new implementation work item

title: A2D ‚Äì AI-Augmented Development
text:
Solution Design & Analysis Workflow


Deep analysis across:

Archetypes

Current repository

Prior problem statements


Produces 2‚Äì3 design options with:

Detailed approaches

Code samples

Markdown documentation


Scores options and makes a recommendation

Also advises on timing:

Do it now vs.¬†defer

title: A2D ‚Äì AI-Augmented Development
text:
Implement Workflow


This is the workhorse of the system

A [coder] agent is instructed to:

Be concise and efficient with changes

Minimize refactoring unless requested

Respect existing patterns and decisions

Write appropriate unit tests

Produce well-documented PRs with screenshots where helpful

title: A2D ‚Äì AI-Augmented Development
text:
Deployment Workflow


Uses a [deployment] agent with skills in:

Terraform
Azure CLI
YAML
GitHub Actions


Responsibilities:

Inspect solution for deployment readiness

Create Terraform and supporting scripts

Ensure environment consistency

Keep secrets safe and managed

Enable repeatable deployments

title: A2D ‚Äì AI-Augmented Development
text:
Workflow Status (MVP View)








Workflow
Status
Notes




Planning
In Progress (~75%)
Enhances work items; needs tighter verbosity and better respect for PR-approval gates.


Solution Design
In Progress (~80%)
Compares paths and recommends one; excellent docs but a bit verbose.


Suggestion
In Progress (~60%)
Prototype that recommends next work; needs refinement.


User Interface Design
Planning (~25%)
Will integrate with Figma/UX MCPs.


Implementation
In Progress (~90%)
Most mature; produces concise, tested code with strong PRs.


Deployment
Planning (~25%)
Good scripts, needs stronger understanding of workflows and approvals.

title: A2D ‚Äì AI-Augmented Development
text:
Methodology Definition

As important as the technology itself

A2D will define ceremonies similar to Agile, but with shorter cycles

Likely better aligned with Kanban than strict sprints

Daily flow typically:

Plan ‚Äì morning planning with agents

Design ‚Äì refine approaches

Implement ‚Äì coding agents execute

Review ‚Äì humans review & approve

Deploy ‚Äì promote safely

Verify ‚Äì validate outcomes


Then repeat

title: A2D ‚Äì AI-Augmented Development
text:
The Human Role


Humans remain central:

Provide context
Set direction & priorities
Give positive and negative feedback

Review and approve all changes


A2D is about augmenting, not replacing, the team

title: A2D ‚Äì AI-Augmented Development
text:
Risks


GitHub Copilot and MCP ecosystem are moving fast

Many features are still in preview

Registries and servers are unstable; things break frequently

GitHub keeps tight control over agents and currently:

Limits coding agents largely to Anthropic Sonnet


Licensing:

$15‚Äì$30 USD per user per month today

Unlikely to stay that low long-term


Agent drift:

Same inputs can produce slightly different outputs

Governance and guardrails are essential

title: A2D ‚Äì AI-Augmented Development
text:
Phased Approach


Start as a services company while artifacts mature

Package mature artifacts as a subscription offering later

Allow time for:

MCP landscape to stabilize

Archetypes & workflows to be battle-tested


Generate revenue while:

Building & testing artifacts

Proving the CodeLantern MCP concept

title: A2D ‚Äì AI-Augmented Development
text:
Use of Funds


Secure key resources (Jeff, PVZ, Nick)

Focus full-time on A2D (modest salary)

Build artifacts & workflows, plus custom MCP to hide IP

Create demos & training to attract delivery consultants

Cover software, operations, and marketing (licenses, conferences, brand, sales collateral)

title: A2D ‚Äì AI-Augmented Development
text:
Next Steps


Work on funding and structure

Secure Jeff, Nick, Peter with the right mix of base + upside

Publish a working MVP demo:

Planning agent
Architect agent
Coding agent
Deployment agent


Document & diagram workflows to:

Attract delivery consultants
Land first customers


Build a Designer workflow demo for extra ‚Äúwow‚Äù

Implement the custom MCP to hide IP

title: A2D ‚Äì AI-Augmented Development
text:
Team & Compensation (Summary)


Nick Van Exan ‚Äì Senior engineer; target ~15K/month, pro-rated; equity/bonus to close gap

Jeff Zado ‚Äì Sales/strategy; could start at ~5K/month + commission + upside

Peter Vander Zouwe ‚Äì Sales/strategy; needs ~8K/month base + commission; open to equity

Use commission-to-equity conversion to:

Align incentives
Minimize burn
Reward early builders

title: A2D ‚Äì AI-Augmented Development
text:
Thank You
Questions? Discussion?

Use this slide to open Q&A and deeper technical or financial discussions depending on the audience.
